eigenvalue decomposition of A⊤A.
4.5.3 Eigenvalue Decomposition vs. Singular Value Decomposition
Let us consider the eigendecomposition A= PDP−1 and the SVD A=
UΣV⊤and review the core elements of the past sections.
The SVD always exists for any matrixRm×n. The eigendecomposition is
only deﬁned for square matrices Rn×n and only exists if we can ﬁnd a
basis of eigenvectors of Rn.
